other_tests.findings: Cortisol response remained normal across evaluations.
Anterior pituitary lobe of diminished height (3 mm; normal, 4.5Â±0.6) with normal pituitary stalk and posterior lobe.
Documented deficiencies in GH, TSH, PRL, LH, and FSH across evaluations.
The F88S mutant showed no significant DNA binding to a PRDQ9 Prop-1 response element compared to wild-type Prop-1.
Transcriptional activation of a luciferase reporter gene containing a PRDQ9 site was reduced to approximately 34% compared with wild-type Prop-1.
